articles.title: OpenAI to acquire Neptune
articles.summary: OpenAI is set to acquire Neptune, a platform that helps companies build and deploy machine learning models. This acquisition is expected to enhance OpenAI's capabilities in model development and deployment, further solidifying its position in the AI industry. The move will likely accelerate the development of more advanced AI technologies and applications.

articles.title: How confessions can keep language models honest
articles.summary: Researchers have discovered that "confessions" - a technique where language models are prompted to admit when they don't know something - can significantly improve their honesty and accuracy. By encouraging models to acknowledge uncertainty, confessions can help mitigate the spread of misinformation and promote more trustworthy interactions. This innovation has the potential to increase transparency and reliability in AI-powered language systems.

articles.title: Announcing the initial People-First AI Fund grantees
articles.summary: The People-First AI Fund has announced its initial grantees, supporting projects that prioritize human well-being and equity in the development of artificial intelligence. These grants aim to promote responsible AI innovation, addressing issues like bias, transparency, and accountability. By funding people-centered AI initiatives, the organization seeks to create a more inclusive and beneficial AI ecosystem.

articles.title: Inside Mirakl's agentic commerce vision
articles.summary: Mirakl is pioneering "agentic commerce," a revolutionary approach that empowers businesses to create personalized, autonomous, and adaptive shopping experiences. This innovative vision leverages AI and machine learning to enable real-time decision-making and tailored customer interactions. By redefining the commerce landscape, Mirakl aims to help companies drive growth and stay competitive in a rapidly evolving market.

articles.title: Funding grants for new research into AI and mental health
articles.summary: Researchers have been awarded funding grants to explore the intersection of AI and mental health, aiming to develop innovative solutions for diagnosis, treatment, and support. This new research initiative seeks to harness the power of AI to improve mental health outcomes and address the growing need for more effective interventions. By combining AI and mental health expertise, scientists hope to create more personalized and accessible care options.

articles.title: Engineering more resilient crops for a warming climate
articles.summary: Scientists are developing more resilient crops to combat the challenges of a warming climate, using advanced engineering techniques to enhance their ability to withstand extreme temperatures and weather conditions. This innovation aims to improve crop yields and food security in the face of rising global temperatures. By creating climate-resilient crops, researchers hope to mitigate the impacts of climate change on agriculture and ensure a sustainable food supply.

articles.title: AlphaFold: Five years of impact
articles.summary: AlphaFold, a revolutionary AI protein-folding model, has made significant impacts in the scientific community over the past five years, accelerating discoveries in fields like medicine and biology. Its ability to accurately predict 3D protein structures has enabled breakthroughs in disease research and drug development. By democratizing access to protein folding predictions, AlphaFold has opened up new avenues for researchers and scientists to explore and innovate.

articles.title: Revealing a key protein behind heart disease
articles.summary: Researchers have identified a key protein that plays a crucial role in the development of heart disease, paving the way for potential new treatments. This breakthrough discovery could lead to more effective therapies for preventing and managing cardiovascular conditions. By understanding the function of this protein, scientists may be able to develop targeted interventions to reduce the risk of heart disease.

articles.title: How we’re bringing AI image verification to the Gemini app
articles.summary: Gemini is integrating AI-powered image verification into its app, enabling users to authenticate the legitimacy of images and combat deepfakes. This innovative feature utilizes machine learning to detect and flag manipulated or fake images, enhancing user trust and safety. By leveraging AI, Gemini aims to stay ahead of emerging threats and provide a more secure experience for its users.

articles.title: Build with Nano Banana Pro, our Gemini 3 Pro Image model
articles.summary: Introducing the Nano Banana Pro, a cutting-edge image model based on the Gemini 3 Pro architecture, allowing developers to build innovative applications with enhanced visual capabilities. This model enables advanced image generation and manipulation, opening up new possibilities for creative and technical projects. With Nano Banana Pro, users can unlock new levels of visual expression and automation.

articles.title: We Got Claude to Fine-Tune an Open Source LLM
articles.summary: Researchers fine-tuned Claude, an AI model, to work with an open-source large language model (LLM), enabling more accessible and customizable language processing capabilities. This breakthrough allows developers to adapt and improve the model for specific tasks, driving innovation in natural language understanding. The collaboration has the potential to accelerate advancements in AI and language technology.

articles.title: Custom Policy Enforcement with Reasoning: Faster, Safer AI Applications
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced a new approach to custom policy enforcement with reasoning, enabling faster and safer AI applications by ensuring they adhere to specific rules and regulations. This innovation allows for more efficient and reliable decision-making in AI systems, reducing the risk of errors or unintended consequences. By integrating reasoning into policy enforcement, developers can create more trustworthy and compliant AI models.

articles.title: Transformers v5: Simple model definitions powering the AI ecosystem
articles.summary: The latest Transformers v5 release simplifies model definitions, making it easier for developers to integrate AI models into their applications. This update empowers the AI ecosystem by providing a more streamlined and accessible way to work with transformer-based models. By reducing complexity, Transformers v5 has the potential to accelerate AI innovation and adoption across various industries.

articles.title: Diffusers welcomes FLUX-2
articles.summary: Diffusers has introduced FLUX-2, a new addition to its platform, which is expected to bring enhanced capabilities and improvements. FLUX-2 is likely to offer advanced features and tools, further expanding the possibilities of diffusers. This update may have significant implications for users, enabling more efficient and effective workflows.

articles.title: Continuous batching from first principles
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced a new approach to continuous batching, a technique that enables more efficient processing of data in artificial intelligence models. By re-examining the fundamentals of batching, this method has the potential to significantly improve the speed and scalability of AI systems. This innovation could lead to breakthroughs in areas like natural language processing and computer vision.

articles.title: State of AI: An Empirical 100T Token Study with OpenRouter
articles.summary: Researchers have released a study on the state of AI, training a massive 100T token model using OpenRouter, a open-source routing framework. This breakthrough achievement demonstrates the potential for open-source AI models to rival those developed by tech giants, promoting greater accessibility and innovation in the field. The study's findings highlight the rapidly advancing capabilities of AI and its potential to drive significant technological progress.

articles.title: How elites could shape mass preferences as AI reduces persuasion costs
articles.summary: A new concept suggests that AI could significantly lower the cost of persuasion, enabling elites to more easily shape public opinion and manipulate mass preferences. This raises concerns about the potential for AI-facilitated influence and control, particularly in the realms of politics and social discourse. As AI-powered persuasion tools become more prevalent, the boundaries between authentic public opinion and manipulated sentiment may become increasingly blurred.

articles.title: We gave 5 LLMs $100K to trade stocks for 8 months
articles.summary: Researchers gave five large language models (LLMs) $100,000 each to trade stocks over an 8-month period, testing their ability to make investment decisions. The results showed that while the LLMs were able to learn and adapt, none of them were able to outperform the S&P 500 index, highlighting the challenges of applying AI to complex financial markets. The experiment provides valuable insights into the limitations and potential of AI-driven trading systems.

articles.title: A Cozy Mk IV light aircraft crashed after 3D-printed part was weakened by heat
articles.summary: A Cozy Mk IV light aircraft crashed due to a 3D-printed engine part that was weakened by heat, highlighting the potential risks of using additive manufacturing in critical aircraft components. The incident underscores the need for rigorous testing and certification of 3D-printed parts in aerospace applications. This crash serves as a cautionary tale for the industry's growing reliance on 3D printing technology.

articles.title: SMS phishers pivot to points, taxes, fake retailers
articles.summary: SMS phishers are shifting their tactics to exploit new targets, including loyalty points, tax refunds, and fake online retailers, in an attempt to trick victims into divulging sensitive information. This pivot highlights the evolving nature of phishing attacks, which continue to adapt to new vulnerabilities and deception methods. As a result, users must remain vigilant and cautious when receiving suspicious messages, especially those related to financial or personal data.

articles.title: Some models of reality are bolder than others
articles.summary: A recent discussion on Hacker News explores the concept of "bold" models of reality, which refer to simulations or theories that challenge our current understanding of the world. These models, such as the simulation hypothesis, propose radical ideas about the nature of reality, encouraging innovative thinking and debate. By considering these unconventional perspectives, researchers and thinkers can push the boundaries of human knowledge and understanding.

articles.title: Microsoft drops AI sales targets in half after salespeople miss their quotas
articles.summary: Microsoft has significantly reduced its AI sales targets by half after its sales team failed to meet their quotas, indicating a slower-than-expected adoption of AI technology. This adjustment suggests that the company is reassessing its expectations for AI revenue growth. The move may impact Microsoft's overall revenue projections and its competitive position in the AI market.
